file_content.text: Oh! I... didn't hear anyone come in. The guards usually call.
If you had an appointment, you should know--my husband is out on business. He'll be back soon.
I need to talk to him. If it's no trouble, I'd rather not have to come back....
Mind if I wait?
I'm not sure. No one said anything about a visitor.
Any idea where your husband is? Who he's with?
What's Milosh doing?
That's not my business. Frankly, I'm not sure it's yours, either.
Who are you, anyway? What do you want here?
Dragon Eyes. I need to know everything Milosh Varta is involved in.
Tell me everything.
What? Oh, please. I don't--he doesn't tell me anything.
Don't worry. Your husband and I go way back. I wanted to surprise him.
I'm Milosh's friend.
That right? He's not big on surprises, but I suppose you know that.
Well. I was about to fix lunch. Care to join me?
That's very kind. Thank you.
I can spare some time.
Wonderful. Please, sit down. We can talk awhile....
That sounds wonderful. We can swap stories about Milosh.
Lunch and gossip?
Oh, I'm sure you have quite a few. Stars know I do....
I'd love to. If I'd known his wife was so charming, I'd have come by sooner.
[Flirt] Of course.
Please, you'll make me blush! Have a seat....
If Milosh were here, I could've left you alone. As it is....
You're in trouble now.
What are you--what are you doing? Where are my guards?
Please. Please don't do this to us. Whatever you want....
I want to know what sort of work Milosh does.
Tell me everything.
I don't--he never says much. He's never said much, even when he was a moisture farmer.
I know he's not involved with the nicest people, but he's not a bad man, I swear....
If you don't know anything, I'll have to go to the source. Take a seat.
Let's wait for him.
I--all right. Please don't hurt him....
You can live, for now. Get in the corner and I'll deal with you later.
Stay out of my way.
That's enough. [Kill her]
Cooperate with me, or you die. On your knees, in the corner.
I'm taking you hostage.
I--I'll do what you say. But you're making a mistake.
I don't need you. [Kill her]
No! I--
Huh. Didn't think you'd do that.
Guess we better wait for Milosh. I'm going to check the kitchen....
She wasn't a threat to us. She could've helped us with Milosh.
We don't leave witnesses alive.
She knew too much.
Yes. We... forget sometimes. Apologies.
It's an ugly job. Better get used to the bloodshed.
You need to toughen up.
I wanted her dead, and it was my call. Understood?
Don't question me.
Understood, Cipher.
Now, we must wait....
Isbet? I'm back.
Who is this? What are you doing here?
Don't be rude, Milosh. I was just telling your friend about the time you sold the farm--
That is not my friend! And things are very dangerous for us now.
It's true--I'm not his friend. And things are dangerous for you.
Milosh is right.
You. What have you done? How dare you invade my home?
You and I are going to have a talk.
I need information.
Frankly, I think your guards are overpaid. Not that it'll be an issue now.
It wasn't very hard.
Where's my wife? Isbet? Isbet...?
If you want the woman to live, I suggest you change your tone.
I have your wife.
What does she mean? What's this all about?
What does he mean? What's this all about?
Shut up! Just... just stay calm.
I already killed one person here. Want to make it two?
Don't suffer like your wife.
She's--Isbet? Isbet?
You--you murdering filth! She did nothing to you....
You can't help her now. You want to survive this, focus on the person with the blaster.
Worry about yourself.
She seemed like a nice woman, but I couldn't let her live.
Sorry about that.
This is pathetic.
Monster. You're--monster.
You were the one asking questions. I was promised you wouldn't survive.
I did survive, and you're going to help me find the ghost cell.
Tell me about the terrorists.
You have no idea who they are.
Who told you I wouldn't survive? How'd you know someone would come after me?
You were "promised"?
They're always watching. As soon as I heard, they heard, too.
The ghost cell tried to kill me. It didn't work.
Your friends failed.
It was not my decision. They watch. They choose what to do themselves.
The ghost cell came to me. They offered the Exchange protection, assassinations, if we gave them what they needed.
What could I say? They're worse than we are. And now you think you frighten me?
We can come to an arrangement, Milosh. All I want is to find their village.
Let's work together.
You killed my wife. What more do you want to arrange?
You're joking. What kind of arrangement?
The Empire can give you full access to Mos Ila in return for your aid.
We'll support the Exchange.
Money. Blood money. I suppose there's little choice.
Yes? It would be a very good opportunity. In return for their village....
The terrorists won't let you live after this... so you need me to stop them.
The cell will try to kill you.
Blackmail. But... I see your point.
I promise the pain will stop. How's that for a deal?
I'll spare you. [Hurt him]
Tell me how to reach them or I put a hole in her head.
Help or your wife dies.
Milosh...?
I hear. I hear.
You aren't getting it. Look at her body. Now where's the cell based?
I already killed your wife.
You... yes. Forgive me, Isbet.
I get their supplies. My men bring the crates to a drop point in the canyons.
From there, the ghost cell brings the supplies home by speeder. The next delivery is soon... beyond that, I know nothing.
I do horrible things too, Milosh. Tell me where the cell is based.
I need more. [Hurt him]
Ah! I... I can tell you... please....
I pack whatever they need... leave the shipment at a drop point in the canyons.
They take the crates home by speeder. The next delivery is soon. That's all I know.
That'll do. Cause me any trouble, and I'll be back.
You've earned your life.
Thank you.
I understand. I will... I will not cause difficulties.
Come, Isbet. Let's get away from here....
Go to... whatever you are doing. I will return for my wife.
Consider this thanks for your assistance.
Good enough. [Kill him]
You didn't have to--ah!
So much bloodshed. So much seems... unneeded.
Nasty. Well, it's not like they have kids. Let's go.
I don't like having strangers in my house.
